data.name: Maximum 2d subarray sum
data.description:
This is simillar to problem stated here https://www.codewars.com/kata/maximum-subarray-sum.

You need to find first maximum 2d subarray from 2d array. 

By maximum I mean maximum by value.
When two arrays have the same value you need to return first spotted.

Please remember to rate this kata, thanks ;)

Output should include (in right orderd):
```python 
[
top_left_corner_x, top_left_corner_y, 
bottom_right_corner_x, bottom_right_corner_y,
max_sum
]
```
If array is all negative or empty return sum as 0.
For example:
```python 
max_sum([
  [1, 2, -1, -4, -20],
  [-8, -3, 4, 2, 1],
  [3, 8, 10, 1, 3],
  [-4, -1, 1, 7, -6]
])
== [1,1,3,3,29]
``` 
Notes:

1. Arrays are not always squares!
2. You need to find FIRST array (closest to top left corner)
3. All rows have the same length
4. When array is empty/all negative I am checking only sum, in other words in my tests only last number is being checked
```
max_sum([[-1],[-1]])[4] == 0 
```
5. BEWARE from now on there are random tests, O((nm)^2) or bigger solution might not pass. What am I testing in random tests? Here is pseudocode : 
```
repeat 50 times :
    M = random from 1 to 100
    N = random from 1 to 100
    array = randomized array N x M
    test array
```
